page.title: 01Bleadon and Hutton area
page.content: The area consists of residential, industrial, agricultural open spaces and a large wood running from west to east on the high ground in this area. The area now includes a new General Hospital in the North-West corner of this area.Due for completion in 1986. Farming is both animal and arable, and covers about 65% of the area. Tourism also plays its part by two large caravan parks in the area plus touring caravans and camping sites at various farms. the area is well endowed with footpaths. Light industry in the North of the area consists of office furniture, audio, computer and aluminium window manufacturing. Social needs are met by three Scout Groups, Three Girl Guide companys, two Youth Clubs, various Church groups, three playgroups, three village/community centres and several riding centres----
